channel.title: Any other way?
channel.description:
Is there any other way I can set up a server [u]without[/u] portforwading. I mean, it's impossible for me to portforward. I tried 100 times, and people still can't go on my server.
I know there's Utorrent, but is there anything else?

item.title: Any other way?
item.dc:creator: @xpatx xpatx
item.description:
@xpatx wrote:

You have to portfoward. Reason because:

Portfowarding allows people onto your network UDP or TCP one way or another. You don’t portfoward, you don’t get players.

Read full topic

item.title: Any other way?
item.dc:creator: @Linkuus Linkuus
item.description:
@Linkuus wrote:

monkeykid300:

To be honest, either you portfowarded it wrong, or some other process you have going on is not working. There are no ways I know to make a server without portfowarding.

Wrong, some routers do have open ports for this. So that you don’t have to Portforward.

Read full topic

item.title: Any other way?
item.dc:creator: @monkeykid300 monkeykid300
item.description:
@monkeykid300 wrote:

To be honest, either you portfowarded it wrong, or some other process you have going on is not working. There are no ways I know to make a server without portfowarding. And remember, at least this is what I believe, you have to portfoward on the computer with the router, not any other one. My dad’s pc had the router, so I had to portfoward my server on that.

Read full topic
